page.title: 07Education in Willingham
page.content: The earliest known school in Willingham was a subscription school, founded in 1593. A{British School}was established in 1856 on a site in Fen End. The building was sold and the school moved to new premises on a site in Thoday's Close in 1975. It is a{County Primary School}taking boys and girls from the age of 4+ until they transfer to secondary school at the age of 11. The roll in 1985 is approximately 260. The nearest secondary school is the {Village College}at Cottenham which is an 11-16{comprehensive}school. Education beyond 16 is catered for by the{sixth form colleges}in Cambridge. Also in Cambridge are the{College of {Arts and Technology}and the {University.}
